title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement mbeck@tbep.org. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to tbeploads
text: outlines propose change tbeploads. detailed discussion contributing package, please see development contributing guide general code review principles.

title: Contributing to tbeploads
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to tbeploads
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone TBEP agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See general guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to tbeploads
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("tbep-tech/tbeploads", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to tbeploads
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to tbeploads
text: Please note tbeploads project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting started
text: Install package r-universe follows. source code available GitHub. Load package R session installation:
code: # Install tbeploads in R: install.packages('tbeploads', repos = c('https://tbep-tech.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org')) library(tbeploads)

title: Getting started
text: Load estimates broadly defined domestic point source (DPS), industrial point source (IPS), nonpoint source (NPS), atmospheric deposition (AD), groundwater sources springs (GW). functions build around source unique inputs .

title: Getting started
text: DPS functions designed work raw entity data provided partners. core function anlz_dps_entity() requires vector file paths input, path points file monthly parameter concentration flow data. data also describe whether observations end pipe (direct inflow bay) reuse (applied land). Different calculations used determine load . file names must follow specific convention, metadata entity found facilities file included package using information file name. convenience, three example files included package. files used input function. Non-trivial data preprocessing needed file included package correct format.
code: fls <- list.files(system.file('extdata/', package = 'tbeploads'),   pattern = '\\.txt$', full.names = TRUE) anlz_dps_entity(fls) #> # A tibble: 120 × 11 #>     Year Month entity  facility coastco source tn_load tp_load tss_load bod_load #>    <int> <int> <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1  2021     1 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.617   0.0301  0.251     1.65   #>  2  2021     2 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.789   0.373   0.279     2.24   #>  3  2021     3 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.393   0.344   0.135     0.842  #>  4  2021     4 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.299   0.234   0.141     0.760  #>  5  2021     5 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.0123  0.0171  0.00776   0.0447 #>  6  2021     6 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.194   0.320   0.113     0.527  #>  7  2021     7 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.610   0.683   0.302     0.604  #>  8  2021     8 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.534   0.487   0.315     0.594  #>  9  2021     9 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   1.01    1.07    0.534     0.762  #> 10  2021    10 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.310   0.324   0.135     0.237  #> # ℹ 110 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: hy_load <dbl>

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe and summarize — anlz_dps
text: Calculate DPS reuse end pipe summarize

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe and summarize — anlz_dps
code: anlz_dps(   fls,   summ = c("entity", "facility", "segment", "all"),   summtime = c("month", "year") )

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe and summarize — anlz_dps
text: fls vector file paths raw entity data, one many summ chr string indicating returned data summarized, see details summtime chr string indicating returned data summarized temporally (month year), see details

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe and summarize — anlz_dps
text: data frame loading data TP, TN, TSS, BOD tons per month/year hydro load million cubic meters per month/year

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe and summarize — anlz_dps
text: Input data files fls first processed anlz_dps_entity calculate DPS reuse end pipe facility outfall.  data can summarized differently based summ summtime arguments.  loading data summed basd arguments, e.g., bay segment (summ = 'segment') year (summtime = 'year').

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe and summarize — anlz_dps

what: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe from raw entity data — anlz_dps_entity
title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe from raw entity data — anlz_dps_entity
text: Calculate DPS reuse end pipe raw entity data

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe from raw entity data — anlz_dps_entity
code: anlz_dps_entity(fls)

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe from raw entity data — anlz_dps_entity
text: fls vector file paths raw entity data, one many

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe from raw entity data — anlz_dps_entity
text: data frame loading data TP, TN, TSS, BOD tons per month hydro load million cubic meters per month.  Information entity, facility, outfall retained.

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe from raw entity data — anlz_dps_entity
text: Input data include flow million gallons per day, conc mg/L.  Steps include: Multiply flow day month get million gallons per month Multiply flow 3785.412 get cubic meters per month Multiply N flow divide 1000 get kg N per month Multiply m3 1000 get L, divide 1e6 convert mg kg, dividing 1000 TN, TP, TSS, BOD dps reuse multiplied attenuation factor land application (varies location) Hydro load (m3 / mo) also attenuated reuse, multiplied 0.6 (40% attenuation)

title: Calculate DPS reuse and end of pipe from raw entity data — anlz_dps_entity
code: fls <- list.files(system.file('extdata/', package = 'tbeploads'),   pattern = '\\.txt$', full.names = TRUE) anlz_dps_entity(fls) #> # A tibble: 120 × 11 #>     Year Month entity  facility coastco source tn_load tp_load tss_load bod_load #>    <int> <int> <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1  2021     1 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.617   0.0301  0.251     1.65   #>  2  2021     2 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.789   0.373   0.279     2.24   #>  3  2021     3 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.393   0.344   0.135     0.842  #>  4  2021     4 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.299   0.234   0.141     0.760  #>  5  2021     5 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.0123  0.0171  0.00776   0.0447 #>  6  2021     6 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.194   0.320   0.113     0.527  #>  7  2021     7 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.610   0.683   0.302     0.604  #>  8  2021     8 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.534   0.487   0.315     0.594  #>  9  2021     9 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   1.01    1.07    0.534     0.762  #> 10  2021    10 Clearw… City of… 387     D-001   0.310   0.324   0.135     0.237  #> # ℹ 110 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: hy_load <dbl>

title: Add column names for DPS reuse and end of pipe from raw entity data — util_dps_addcol
code: pth <- system.file('extdata/ps_dom_hillsco_falkenburg_2019.txt', package = 'tbeploads') dat <- read.table(pth, skip = 0, sep = '\t', header = TRUE) util_dps_addcol(dat) #>    Permit.Number         Facility.Name Outfall.ID Year Month #> 1        FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019     1 #> 2        FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019     2 #> 3        FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019     3 #> 4        FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019     4 #> 5        FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019     5 #> 6        FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019     6 #> 7        FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019     7 #> 8        FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019     8 #> 9        FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019     9 #> 10       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019    10 #> 11       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019    11 #> 12       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      D-001 2019    12 #> 13       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019     1 #> 14       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019     2 #> 15       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019     3 #> 16       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019     4 #> 17       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019     5 #> 18       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019     6 #> 19       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019     7 #> 20       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019     8 #> 21       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019     9 #> 22       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019    10 #> 23       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019    11 #> 24       FL00407 Falkenburg Road AWWTF      R-001 2019    12 #>    Average.Daily.Flow..ADF...mgd. what: Create a data frame of formatting issues with DPS input files — util_dps_checkfls

title: Create a data frame of formatting issues with DPS input files — util_dps_checkfls
code: util_dps_checkfls(pth)

title: Create a data frame of formatting issues with DPS input files — util_dps_checkfls
text: pth path parent directory raw entity data

title: Create a data frame of formatting issues with DPS input files — util_dps_checkfls
text: data.frame three columns indicating name file name, chk file issue, nms concatenated string column names file

title: Create a data frame of formatting issues with DPS input files — util_dps_checkfls
text: chk column indicates issue file indicate "ok" issues found, "read error" file read, "check columns" column names expected.  file showing "ok" checked issues. files checked util_dps_checkuni file read error.

title: Create a data frame of formatting issues with DPS input files — util_dps_checkfls
code: pth <- system.file('extdata/ps_dom_hillsco_falkenburg_2019.txt', package = 'tbeploads') pth <- dirname(pth) util_dps_checkfls(pth) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   name                               chk   nms                                   #>   <chr>                              <chr> <chr>                                 #> 1 ps_dom_clearwater_ne_2021.txt      ok    Permit.Number, Facility.Name, Year, … #> 2 ps_dom_hillsco_dalemabry_1718.txt  ok    Permit.Number, Facility.Name, Outfal… #> 3 ps_dom_hillsco_falkenburg_2019.txt ok    Permit.Number, Facility.Name, Outfal…

title: Get DPS entity information from file name — util_dps_entinfo
text: pth path raw entity data asdf logical, TRUE return data.frame

title: Get DPS entity information from file name — util_dps_entinfo
text: list data.frame (asdf = TRUE) entity, facility, permit, facility id, coastal id, coastal subbasin code

title: Get DPS entity information from file name — util_dps_entinfo
text: Bay segment integer values 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 55 Old Tampa Bay, Hillsborough Bay, Middle Tampa Bay, Lower Tampa Bay, Boca Ciega Bay, Terra Ceia Bay, Manatee River, Boca Ciega Bay South, respectively.

title: Get DPS entity information from file name — util_dps_entinfo
code: pth <- system.file('extdata/ps_dom_hillsco_falkenburg_2019.txt', package = 'tbeploads') util_dps_entinfo(pth) #> $entity #> [1] "Hillsborough Co." #>  #> $facname #> [1] "Falkenburg AWTP" #>  #> $permit #> [1] "FL0040614" #>  #> $facid #> [1] "59" #>  #> $coastco #> [1] "381" #>  #> $coastid #> [1] "D_HC_3P" #>

title: Fill missing DPS data with annual average — util_dps_fillmis
text: Input data frame missing values, otherwise missing data filled described .
